reviews.title: MATH 1014
reviews.comment_content: Integration techniques, Improper integrals, Applications of integrals, Infinte sequences and series, Power series
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was quite nice, he really cares about students' learning progress.
He would ask constantly  whether we have any questions, and he would try to explain once again when there is any questions.
Sometimes he would also share his experience, which made our classmates more focused on what he is saying.
However, people are more likely to response when he is talking about his past instead of teaching, so it might not help us in understanding the lecture.
Also, we are having lessons with zoom in this semester, but he was still using a PHYSICAL WHITEBOARD in his room. It might be because he did not know how to use a virtual whiteboard, but the main point is that, it was really blur af, we could barely see what did he write, so it was quite hard to catch up.
Right, we could ask him questions when we do not understand, but he barely looks at the chatroom in zoom.
We all prefer to type in chatroom to ask questions, 'cause turning on a mic and speak was really awkward, I hope everyone would understand this. BUT, he doesn't look at the chatroom even he was sitting in front of the computer silently and waiting for questions. Some of us might be more brave so they would speak and ask, however the professor would always return us with a sentence "I don't know what you don't understand". Yea, we also don't know what we don't understand but we just can't get the idea, that's why we are asking the question lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got full marks in all assignments, but I got only 45/100 in final.
The marks distribution was assignment 25%, final 75%.
And I got a C at the end.
I thought I could get a slightly higher grade with full marks in assignment, but seems my final score really dragged my grade down so much.
reviews.comment_workload:
It was alright.
We got 10 assignments in total.
Although Classviva always crack, our professor helped us to extend our deadline, so sufficient working time was guaranteed.
I used to try those assignments out right after it is released, so I can do everything when the server is not overloaded. (I could have more time to work on wrong answers too.

reviews.author: UstK
reviews.title: Very not good
reviews.comment_content: This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the second in the MATH 1013 â€“ MATH 1014 sequence. Topics include applications of definite integral, improper integrals, vectors, curves and parametric equations, modeling with differential equations, solving simple differential equations, infinite sequences and series, power series and Taylor series.
reviews.comment_teaching:
bad teacher very annoying
never attended lessons
can skip all lessons get good grade
reviews.comment_grading:
Hard very hard
25% class visa
75% final
very very harsh
not nice
reviews.comment_workload:
very high but I didn't do a lot of it
can find gun help u do

reviews.author: Dddd
reviews.comment_content:
Integration
Integration by parts
Integration by substitution
Integration involving trigonometry
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is a bit boring. TA reply very slow. Extremely difficult to understand what she is saying.
Sometimes English sometimes Putonghua.
Always off topic in the lesson.
Don't give me time to think about her questions in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: Harsh as online bend curve is not fair. Very bad grade. Those who get high grade is really astonishing. Bad exam, very few time and has lots of MCs.
reviews.comment_workload: ok, only online homework, not so difficult, can handle.

reviews.author: cnyu
reviews.title: Practice makes perfect
reviews.comment_content:
is the extended part of MATH1013
More about the integration and a little bit about the 3D coordinate system
Thanks to the pandemic, we just have a final exam
reviews.comment_teaching: mainly study by myself
reviews.comment_grading:
absolutely grading
19-20 spring too many people got high marks so A range is harder to get.
The cut-off of A- is from 87.5 to 92.5
hard-working is needed
practice makes perfect
just do more paper and train yourself to be more familiar with the topic
good grades are not hard to get
your effort will not be in vain
reviews.comment_workload:
at the end of the topic will have homework
homework questions are mostly discussed in lecture

reviews.author: TANGTANG
reviews.comment_content: TK Lam is always perfect. Everything taught in this class was clear and useful
reviews.comment_teaching: He often summarizes the content taught in the previous classes.
reviews.comment_grading: Only homework and a final exam. The grade is good but A+ is a little bit hard to get. I got full marks in homework but got 95/100 in final exams. And I just got A in this class, so it is hard to say the grading is good or not.
reviews.comment_workload: Just make use of TK's lesson and do some review from time to time. It is enough to get a good grade.

reviews.author: kikoforlove
reviews.comment_content:
extension for math1013 about integrals
including mainly a lot of methods for calculating integrals.
Overall, it could be far more difficult than what it is taught right now. Professors only teach some basic ideas and examples, which is also the exam content.
relatively easy class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
emmm this prof has mainland accent, but not that strong.
She teaches in a good and patient way. We use her detailed hand written notes to have lessons and do the review. So i thought it may be OK to skip lessons...(just remember to look carefully to the notes XDï¼‰
Anyway i fell asleep quite a few times near the end of some classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
I thought the grading is very strict.
We only have homeworks and final exam this semester. I got full mark for both homework and final exam so A+ was my final result. But my bf got only one MC question wrong in the final exam then he just got A.
Competition is fierce then...
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this class is the lightest for me in the last semester. Only homework and final~Try to listen carefully in the class then it will be fine.

reviews.author: lalalally
reviews.comment_content:
More about differentiation and integration after taking MATH1012/MATH1013.
It depends on each student's ability in understanding differentiation and integrations.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Detailed steps. Give many examples for each formula.
He provides many resources and notes after each lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading. To get a B, a students has to achieve >80/100 in the final exam. Assignments take a little percentage in the overall grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Approximately one homework on Classviva per week.
To achieve a better grade in this course, more exercises should be done.
No midterm. There are around 10 assignments in this course.

reviews.author: NaturalEthan
reviews.title: It's a self-study course
reviews.comment_content:
The course focus on three topics:
Applications of definite integral, improper integrals

Curves and parametric equations, modeling with differential equations, solving simple differential equations.

Infinite sequences and series, power series, and Taylor series.

vectors (it was not taught, and it's not in the final coverage)

The content is fairly well. And the textbook is arranged appropriately. But I think it's too easy for those in SSCI who don't want to take MATH 1023/MATH 1024.

And it's a pity that there is no time remaining for vectors.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fairly speaking, CHING Avery is a very enthusiastic professor, and he spares efforts in teaching this course. He will provide the typed course notes after every lecture. However, the experience is not good. The teaching pace is too slow, and the teaching style is very boring. Avery's monotonous class lures you to sleep. So I learn these contents by my self since the textbook and the notes because they are well designed and I suggest you learn it in that way.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading..... I think is not good at all. We have 10 more homework on ClassViva, and it's easy for all of you to get full marks. However, there is no midterm this semester and we have only one final exam. But the final exam is designed in a very bad way: 20 multiple choices and 2 hours time. Fairly speaking, if you do your daily works well, it's easy for you to get 90+ or even 100. As I know lots of students get 100. So if you make some small mistakes and get 95(5 points per question), you can only get A. A + is only for those whom get full marks in both homework and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Too light!
I suggest you buy some practice books (especially from the Mainland because their math teaching standard is very high). The book I use is called â€œå‰ç±³å¤šç¶­å¥‡â€ in Chinese, and it's a little more difficult than our final exam.

reviews.author: Midnite
reviews.title: Good for People who hates memorizing
reviews.comment_content: All about Calculus II, from simple integral, its applications, series, Taylor and McLaurin, etc. The content itself is pretty good and wholesome containing all the basics and some advanced level questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Overall Ms. Ye Guibo teaching feels the best as her English is quite fluent and she taught examples in her lecture. She is not the type to just read off from lecture slides which makes the lecture much more interesting. As for the overall notes, LAM, Tsz Kim provides better and more accurate notes, more similar to the tests and tutorials given.
reviews.comment_grading: This semester the grading was the worst as it only consists of 10 homework (25%) and a final exam (75%). The final exam itself only has 20 multiple choice questions, so it really depends on luck for some students rather than true knowledge. Most of the questions are usually similar to the tutorials but some advanced questions are included to test the students.
reviews.comment_workload: There's not much workload except for the weekly homework given. The homework has a very long deadline so it's quite flexible. Although better not submit it near deadline as the servers tend to be very laggy near deadline.

reviews.author: questionmark
reviews.title: HKUST Math course is horrible
reviews.comment_content:
Applications of definite integral, improper integrals, curves and parametric equations, modelling with differential equations, solving simple differential equations, infinite sequences and series, power series and Taylor series.

This course is very difficult for me, even though I got 5* in HKDSE Math. (Probably because I have never learnt calculus before :)
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor speaks very slow but clear. The note is easy to understand! (for most of the students I guess)
reviews.comment_grading: I did not understand the course at all and didn't do great in the exam, although I tried really hard to study.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on how much time you put in this course. If you are really good at calculus, I think the workload is very little as there were only assignments and final exam. However, I am not smart enough to understand the course material, and finally, I ruined my CGA :(

reviews.author: nhc
reviews.title: Professor not as good as people described
reviews.comment_content:
Extension of Math1013, parts of the syllabus included in the DSE M2 syllabus. Good luck if you studied M1 before.
Topics assessed mainly include
- DSE M2 Definite and indefinite integral topics
- Partial and improper integrals
- polar coordinates
- Infinite series and sequences
- Test for convergence and divergence


Last 2 topics are the hardest in my opinion. Vectors are also taught but not assessed this semester.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As the title suggested. Anticipated before the course because I heard that Professor Lam was very good, but was disappointed.

He knows the syllabus well and his English is very good, but his notes are very messy and is difficult to spot important points. (Luckily met a nice TA who have well-organised notes that shows important points.)

Lots of examples given, yet very basic. I cannot see how they helped me in using them in higher level questions, especially for topics after integration.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final exam: 75% (20 MCs, 5 marks per each)
Classviva homework: 25%

Doubt whether this is the grading method in other semesters, other semesters probably have a midterm for this course.

Usually absolute grading but not for this semester. The B range is VERY WIDE. Seems like they pulled the marginal A ranges down a grade and pulled marginal C ranges up.

Full marks in homework and got 75% in finals. Got B at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not very heavy workload, 10 Classviva homework in total, around once a week.

Homework will be given in advance, can be done way before the deadline. The server crashes easily and usually breaks down before homework deadlines, so I gave a C.

reviews.author: {Curly Braces}
reviews.title: Difficult course
reviews.comment_content:
This course is part 2 of the basic calculus you need to learn. This covers:
Integration by substitution
Integration by parts
Integration techniques (Rational and Trigonometric functions)
Integral Approximation
Improper integral
Areas, Volumes, Arc Length and Surface area of a curve
Work
Calculus of Polar Equations
Sequences and its convergence
Testing the Convergence of Series
Taylor Series
Radius of Convergence of Power Series
Operation of Power Series
Vectors (Not included in this semester due to insufficient time)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Well, I pretty much skipped most of the classes lol.
Although his presentation is not bad, his tone seems a little bit unengaging, however.
reviews.comment_grading:
Warning: The grading policy cannot be taken as a reference at your semester, as this semester cancelled the mid-term exam because the semester started late (as well as other reasons).

Assignments: 25%
Final Exam: 75%

This would be pretty unfair to most students, as the final exam consists only MCQs. In other words, students that are lucky can pretty much get A to B range with no efforts.

Side note: One may say that most professors in this course are traps. I won't disagree with this statement. and I think the most effective way to get a good grade in this course is to spend time to learn by yourself.
reviews.comment_workload: Seemingly very few for students with calculus backgrounds. However, don't get fooled! Even if you have calculus backgrounds, it is better to pay some efforts in this course and learn each concept, understand when to use each convergence tests, or when to apply each formula.

reviews.author: hypetrain
reviews.comment_content: Integration by different methods, including by parts, trig substitution, partial fractions and other. Convergence and Divergence of Series. No vectors this term due to the pandemic. Don't think the content is that hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: Bearable accent but doesn't teach very well. Is unfamiliar with the exams. Tutorials are both useless and useful at the same time. TAs do the homework questions and post the answers on Canvas. But besides that they're completely trash with heavy heavy mainland accents and don't teach anything else. So if you are lazy and don't wanna do the hw sets they're pretty good.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Homework
75% Final (20 MCs)
Supposedly absolute grading, they changed it after the marks for final came out and made it harsher for everyone.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little. TAs give out answers to the 9 homework sets so that's free 25% everyone should get. The only workload is to self-study the course and most importantly, do past papers. The questions are altered from past papers so remember to do those. There will also be cross topic questions, such as Volume of revolution and Trapezium Rule or Simpson's rule, or Partial Fractions and Trigo Substitution all in one integral.

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: Forced to suffer
reviews.comment_content:
Continuation of MATH1013, contents are surprisingly not too boring.

I would also consider it to be easier (slightly) when compared to 1013, since it is a little bit more straight forward. Vector and matrix were not included in the exams so I cannot comment on that. Overall it was acceptable.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Didn't bother after 1 lecture, poor English, reads right off the textbook, no point of attending lectures.

Tutorials are better, as it actually helps with doing questions, so I recommend going to those instead of lectures, but even those are not very useful.

Like 1013 you are forced to study on your own, I highly recommend Khan academy and professor Leonard on youtube if you want to study, especially for professor Leonard since he uploads FULL lectures on everything taught in this course with VERY clear explanations, and native English.

Here is his youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoHhuummRZaIVX7bD4t2czg
reviews.comment_grading:
25% WebWork, 75% Online final

The online final: 20 MC questions, open book, which is nice as you don't have to memorize the formulas and instead focus on understanding the formulas, it made the finals easier.

However, the finals is STILL quite difficult. Especially if you are a M1 student like me, however I would consider the exams to be easier than 1013.

For the homework, its entirely possible to get full mark on every webwork since you can google the questions (even if you don't have chegg), if you are willing to spend the time its very doable, you also have infinite attempts, so you can spam and brute force some answers (if you are REALLY struggling).

Overall I got full marks in the homework and 65/100 in the finals, and got a B-, fair grade considering I was only 2-3% higher than the mean.
reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the time spent on this course would be learning the course contents yourself, since the lectures are useless.

As for the WebWork and studying, webwork isn't too difficult, since you can Google almost EVERY question, even if you don't have Chegg like me, you can still find simliar questions that would help you figure out how to do the questions.

Of course you would need to study for the Finals, and that takes a few days to prepare for, do the past papers and you would have a general sense on what to expect.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: One question one sub-grade for this semester.
reviews.comment_content: Check the others. The same stuff without vectors this year. However the instructor still taught us vectors.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Did not know how he taught because I only attended one of his lectures and I just self studied for the rest of the semester.
Phyllis Liang's tutorial is THE BEST. PLEASE TAKE HER TUTORIALS IF YOU WANT A+ FOR BOTH 1013 AND 1014.
reviews.comment_grading:
The online exam is much much MUCH more simple than the previous years' final exams. Because they only include multiple choice questions and they do not have the crazy ass proof questions like 014 in the year 2011. That was hard. Although the Taylor Series might be a little hard, this year the multiple questions only include one question about it. And it is very EZ. So the grading might be better than the previous years' because you do NOT have to study that much to get into A range.(Probably since the grades have not come out yet. I would update when it comes out for sure. )
If you get 100 for homework:
all correct means A+, 1 and 2 wrong means A, 3 wrong means A-, 4 wrong means B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty light since there are only 9 webworks and they are easy if you get the main ideas. Did not spent much time learning mathematics this semester. This course probably has the lightest workload compared with the other courses I selected this semester LOLLLLLL.

reviews.author: Spicylemon
reviews.title: Decent, but concepts might be confusing
reviews.comment_content:
Arc Surface
Areas
Integration
Sequences and series
Vectors
Volumes

Nothing too difficult about the content; however, the tricky part will come in from proving if something is divergent/ convergent as different types of question will require very different solving solutions. If no revision is done, one might not even know what the question is asking and how the answer should look like.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Chiang is a decent teacher who is willing to explain concepts and tries his best in delivering the content to us via the whiteboard. He also has handwritten notes uploaded on canvas with classwork solutions. However, as much as he puts effort into the notes and lectures, there are, however, some errors in the notes and he will get himself confused over his own teachings too. Nevertheless, he tries his best to make the lesson lively by making some jokes along the way, and those efforts should not go unappreciated.

About the tutorials: tutorial notes are very thorough with a lot of examples to practice with. There is not enough time to finish all the work and therefore one should choose carefully what to do!
reviews.comment_grading:
Nothing speical about the grading as it should be absolute grading; however, MCQs are weighted very heavily given that the paper is out of 100 and each MCQ counts for 6 marks. No partial marks is given for MCQ, so it is very important to be very familiar with the content taught in class to get them right.

Remember to review exam papers after getting them graded as there could be mistakes in marking. Tutors are however fabulous at explaining webworks.

Final grade: MIA as finals are still to be taken.
reviews.comment_workload: WebWork once a week; questions cover everything taught in class. However, it might be overwhelming at times as some of the contents on WebWork is given prior to the lecture being given, which will require self study to solve them. Math support center comes in very helpful here as many of the helpers there are very familiar with Math1014 and will always take the time to explain a concept until you understand it.

reviews.author: å˜‰é´»
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about integration. It is easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: So bad. You wont know what the pofessor is talking about. They have strong mainland tone. You can study yourself.
reviews.comment_grading: If you have took M2/M1 in high school, the course is easy for you. You can also practice the past paper. It is quite similar to exam or midterms. For the Webwork, 100% score is basic.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not that high.
Webworks, midterm, and final exam are included in the course.
It is about 1 webwork per two weeks. Each webwork is about 10 to 20 questions.
Webwork is easy, you can search some of the answers by directly copying the question to google.

reviews.author: L.LP
reviews.title: Work hard.
reviews.comment_content:
It is about integration .
You should first familiar with how to do integration using different techniques like substitution, by part ...
Once you master those skills, try to understand the formula of integration..
Like what is the principle of integration.
reviews.comment_teaching: His note is quite good,and usually his lecture will be full.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.
For me, 90.4 gets A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork is not a lot. But if you want to get higher mark  try to do exercise in classviva or buying mainland chinese text booK.. Moreover you should better do more past papers before the midterm.

reviews.author: Layor
reviews.title: An easy course if you had studied M2 in DSE
reviews.comment_content:
Covering some calculus knowledge that taught in high schools, like definite integrals, the fundamental theorem of calculus, area under curves and volume of revolution. Also, there will have some new stuff like finding length of curves or surface area of revolution, basically such new stuff will only need to memorize its equation and used in the exam.
Polar coordinates and a little bit of vector topic will also be taught but this won't go so deep.
reviews.comment_teaching: Depends on your instructor, I only attend the first few lectures last semester as the english of my instructor is bad and I just barely understand what he says.
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance required!

15% by online homework
35% by midterm exam
50% by final exam

Basically you must get full marks in online homework as you have unlimited attempts. However, unlike MATH1013 are using webworks, and instead, classviva are using in this course and this online platform is much troubler than the previous one as you can only check your answer after you finish all questions.

The final exam was easy and I only lose few marks in there, however, because my poor result in mid-term (make many careless mistakes and just barely get half of the total marks), I get only B+ at last. But you can get a high grade easily as long as you be careful enough.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload as online homework is extremely easy.
Only midterm and final exam are the concerns. But still, don't leave your study at the last moment!

reviews.author: twww
reviews.comment_content: Contents were surprisingly interesting. It's okay. The contents is useful for your future!!!!
reviews.comment_teaching: you need to go lecture because you dont have any notes.  he spoke with lots of 'uhh' inside his teaching which makes it really hard to understand what he said. hopefully, you understand what is he saying.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute Grading

15% Webwork
35% Midterm
50% Final
+8% 4 Bonus Quizzes
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light!!
Homework on Webwork every week. Not that hard though.
Just try to practice the questions by yourself and there's nothing to worry about the mid-term and the final exam.

reviews.author: Keane
reviews.comment_content:
Things are quite practical and useful. The whole course is about integration(~70%) and series(~25%), and with a bit vectors.
For topics, just refer to other reviews.
In the midterm, because no calculator policy, some number in some question is quite difficult to work with. Spending 10 mins in only one integral is normal. I kind of sure they do it on purpose. And in final, seemed the numbers are optimised a little so that can be easier calculated.  
The homework helps you understand the concepts very much. Some are very difficult. If encounter any problems, just go to math support centre. I finished half of the homework there. So does textbook. You can somehow find the whole textbook online. Read them if losing the lecture content.
reviews.comment_teaching: His voice makes me sleepy. But still understandable. However I don't pay too much attention to what he said. I rely on Math support center and textbook very much. The reason I go to lecture is to ask him help with some questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.
I got
full in homework
~73%(Dont quite remember)
~90%(Same)
No bonus quizzes that semester
In total 85.5%, A-.
a prof said 90% is A in that semester.
reviews.comment_workload: kind of heavy. but handleable. Just ask the TA, go to math support centre and read textbook if problems. And get homework done as soon as possible once they are available.

reviews.author: angiechan
reviews.comment_content: It's about vectors, differential equations, sequence. Mainly about integration and divergence or convergence. It will be better if you have studied M2 before. If you have never study extend math, it will be tough for you.

reviews.comment_grading: The grade is based on while grading instead of the curve. This year, there are no bonus quiz. Remember to finish all your homework.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to work hard before your miss term and final. I believe your hardwork will pay off. The homework have to done in classviva but not webwork.

reviews.author: woodyyyy

reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, area between curves.
Week 2 Volumes by cross-sections, volumes by cylindrical shells.
Week 3 Work, average value of a function, arc length.
Week 4 Area of a surface of revolution, integration by parts.
Week 5 Trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitution.
Week 6 Polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions, summary of integration techniques.
Week 7 Approximation integration, improper integrals.
Week 8 Infinite sequences and series, integral test.
Week 9 Comparison tests, alternating series, absolute convergence, ratio and root tests
Week 10 Power series, represention of functions as power series .
Week 11 Taylor and Maclaurin series, applications of Taylor polynomials.
Week 12 Two and three dimensional coordinate systems, vectors.
Week 13 Dot product, cross product.

reviews.author: Fairyfire
reviews.title: Straightforward and Fair
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:
Basic integrals: e.g. area between curves
Volumes by cylindrical shells
Arc length and area of a surface
Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals
Trigonometric substitutions and polar coordinates
Partial fractions and strategy for integration
Approximation integration and improper integrals

Midterm

Sequences and series, integral tests
Various tests for convergence and divergence
Testing series, power series
Taylor and Maclaurin series
Applications of Taylor polynomials
vectors in three-dimension
Dot product, cross product

Policy:
15% Homework(Classviva)
35% Midterm
50% Final

Basically, materials before midterm are simple and do not need the effort to handle, but the contents after the midterm become a bit hard and require some self-practice. Fortunately, both the midterm and the final exam are really easy, especially for the final exam which is even easier than the sample paper.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Wang's organizes the lecture notes very well and her pronunciation is pretty ok. You may feel the class would be a bit tedious, but overall Wang's teaching is quite good. She explains concepts clearly and will give us lots of examples. She also has review notes which are quite helpful before exams.
Also, she is willing to answer students' questions.

Provisional grades:
100%â‰¥A+/A/A-â‰¥85%>B+/B/B-â‰¥70% >C+/C/C-â‰¥50%>Dâ‰¥40%>F

reviews.comment_workload:
Not much. If you hate maths, then do not take this course for any other reason since you will feel awful for the calculations.
According to my friends, this course is much simpler than math1024 and also has a better grading scheme. So if you are not a math guy, go ahead to take it and enjoy the satisfaction of solving questions.

reviews.author: hy0914
reviews.title: Better than 1013
reviews.comment_content:
It's a lot clearer and easier than math1013 to me.
Somehow after studying 1013 I don't know what I have learnt from the course, while 1014 is a lot better as there is less vague theories.
If you have studied M2 in secondary school, it will be quite easy for you to handle the topics before mid term. Things get a little bit harder after it but it is still acceptable.
reviews.comment_teaching: I could not comment much on his teaching as I didn't attend any one of the lectures, but from what I see in his we chat group, he rarely answer the questions from his students and has bad English. And sometimes he just directly treat your question as air.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is ok.
It uses absolute grading as I remember.
I saw from the reviews that previous years has some bonus quiz, but we don't have it this year. Maybe due to the fair average marks this year.
reviews.comment_workload: What you need to do per week or 2 weeks is just a set of homework on class viva. Never do your homework near the dead line as this site have a lot of problems. Most of the time you cannot submit your homework or even can't enter the site. It's terrible and even after the IT technician fixed it, it still fails.

reviews.author: HellenaHo
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus mostly are calculus (integration by parts or substitution and involving trigonometry)

- Area of a region between curves, volume by slicing and cylindrical shells
- Length of curves, surface area, work, average value of a function
- Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions
- Numerical integration, improper integrals
- Sequences and infinite series, divergence and integral, ratio, root and comparison tests, alternating series
- Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series
- Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross product

reviews.title: Learn by yourselves
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite easy.
if ur from mainland or some other places, then up to 50% of the materials would be already leaned during ur high school. Then 20% would be sth than have close relationship with the stuff u learned before.

No comment.

A lot of people said that the paper is super easy this year.

Overall grade: 96.95% (A+)
Happy

reviews.author: I_am_not
reviews.comment_content:
-  Techniques of Integration (trigo substitution, IBP)
-  Further Applications of Integration (arc length, surface of revolution)
-  Parametric Equations and Polar Coordinates (include area)
-  Infinite Sequences and Series (test for convergence, power and taylor series)
-  Vectors and the Geometry of Space (Dot and cross products)
reviews.comment_teaching: I skipped most of her lecture so I have no comment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading for letter grades. Same grading scheme as MATH 1013:
100% â‰¥ A+/A/A- â‰¥ 85% > B+/B/B- â‰¥ 70% > C+/C/C- â‰¥ 50% > D â‰¥ 40% > F

Both midterm and final exam for this sem are weirdly very easy. If you aim for an A-, careless mistakes would not be fatal that it won't be as difficult as the previous offerings. However, subgrades are graded using curves so you have to be careful in order to get a higher grade.

My grades:
HW: 15/15
MT: 93/100 (Mean: 64.75) => 32.55/35
Final: 84/100 (Mean: 68.92) => 42/50
Overall: 89.55/100 => A-

I emailed the prof about the cutoff of A range which she tells me that 90.5 is the cutoff for A/A+
reviews.comment_workload:
There is a total of 10 HWs. You get more at the start of the semester and less near the end of the semester.

P.S. many people forgot to do their hw after midterm.

Can find both demonstrations and practice questions so there is not need to find other learning material online. Just make sure you can understand everything in the slide and it will be fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
For this semester, all the exam is quite easy compared to the sample and past paper. Therefore, there isnâ€™t bonus quiz for us.
Get 96.6 in total for A+.
reviews.comment_workload: I really hate the webwork homework. Luckily the number wonâ€™t change for another attempt so it can save a lot of time. But homework is still quite challenging and require much efforts. Also, donâ€™t be a deadline fighter as the system may break down unexpectedly.

reviews.author: Tommy Li
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers a few chapters of the textbook "Calculus, Early Transcendentals"

-  Techniques of Integration (trigo substitution, IBP)
-  Further Applications of Integration (arc length, surface of revolution)
-  Parametric Equations and Polar Coordinates (include area)
-  Infinite Sequences and Series (test for convergence, power and taylor series)
-  Vectors and the Geometry of Space (Dot and cross products)

I personally quite like the infinite series part. The topic is also quite useful for other area such as CS (e.g. observing the limiting behaviour, series expansion for computation).
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say it is not bad nor good. She explained the content clearly while sticking closely to the lecture notes. Some of my friend don't like her accent but I have no problem listening to her.

Her notes is clear and supplemented with examples (quite similar to Guibo's notes). You can surely skip the lecture and read notes by yourself. (I skipped only 2 lessons tho)
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading for letter grades. Same grading scheme as MATH 1013:
100% â‰¥ A+/A/A- â‰¥ 85% > B+/B/B- â‰¥ 70% > C+/C/C- â‰¥ 50% > D â‰¥ 40% > F

Both midterm and final exam are weirdly very easy. If you aim for an A-, careless mistakes would not be fatal that it won't be as difficult as the previous offerings. However, subgrades are graded using curves so you have to be careful in order to get a higher grade.

My grades:
HW: 15/15
MT: 84/100 (Mean: 64.75) => 29.4/35
Final: 92/100 (Mean: 68.92) => 46/50
Overall: 90.4/100 => A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload depends on what grade you want to get. If you just want to complete the course, doing all HW would not be too much workload. However, you have to practice much more to be careful enough to get a good grade.

There is total of 10 HWs. You get more at the start of the semester and less near the end of semester.

reviews.author: marcus0506
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 6: Section 6.1 - 6.5 (Applications of Integration)
Chapter 7: Section 7.1 - 7.8 (Integration Techniques, including improper integrals)
Chapter 8: Section 8.1 - 8.2 (Arc length and Surface Area)
Chapter 10: Section 10.3 - 10.4 (Polar coordinates and calculus)
Chapter 11: Section 11.1 - 11.11 (Infinite sequences and series, power series)
Chapter 12: Section 12.1 - 12.4 (Vectors, dot product, cross product)

Midterm syllabus: Chapter 6,7 (Integration Techniques only),8,10
Final syllabus: All

P.S. If you have studied M2 in secondary school, topics about integration and vectors are not problems to you. The main focus is to know very well about the series part. It is more practical than theoretical in MATH 1014.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ke Wangâ€™s lesson is neither interesting nor boring. Just an ordinary mathematics lesson for me. Her notes were similar to Ye Guiboâ€™s, but obviously better than Yeâ€™s. Some may judge her accent but I think her accent wasnâ€™t bad. Although I skipped most of the lessons (it is NOT advised to do so because the syllabus talking about Sequence and Series after midterm were indeed demanding), she explained concepts clearly and at the end of the course, she even provided supplementary notes and solutions to Divergence/Convergence, Series and Vectors.

For my tutorial session, it is totally useless as the tutorial notes werenâ€™t well-designed. Every tutorial note consists of 4 pages in which there were only two worked examples and two practice questions. Very few! Compared to my friendâ€™s tutorial notes, there were much more pages (over 10 pages) which greatly helped me understand the content. The examples were similar to those in Classviva. And therefore I skipped all tutorial lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
It should be absolute grading.
There is NO bonus quizzes this semester.

Midterm Statistics:
Mean: 61.21   SD: 23.88
Final Statistics:
Mean: around 70

Homework (15%): 100/100
Midterm (35%): 76/100
Final (50%): 91/100
Overall: 87.1/100 (A-)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not light compared to MATH 1013. The homework system changed from Webwork to Classviva. I nearly went crazy doing the first assignment as the system is poor that the whole assignment had to be done again if incorrect answers were recognized. This is totally different from Webwork! At the same time, there were many bugs and errors before the submission deadline and very often the submission deadlines were postponed to the day after. Beware of the submission time as it was quite tricky to be stated like 4:50 a.m..

For my revision, I printed out Keâ€™s notes as I couldnâ€™t just skim and scan the notes without practicing questions. All you have to do is to understand the concepts of divergence/convergence clearly and Iâ€™m sure you can master most of the questions in the final exam paper.

reviews.author: Never Social
reviews.title: Is this semester particularly easy?
reviews.comment_content:
Please refer to other post for the generals.

Weekly assignments are done on Classviva (platformed deved by UST) in selected classes. Though literally 2 times before the deadline the platform goes unresponsive for hours and 1 time it literally showed me an error: CODE ERROR HAVE TO BE FIXED BY A PROGRAMMER, it redeemed itself by boasting a ridiculously ridiculous amount of exercises and full solution (seriously lol 20+ questions for even the most trival concepts), something not available in Webwork.

The mt/final is somehow less theoretical, more practical then those in Math1013. As I'm not a MATH major so I did pretty good by drilling exercises.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ke Wang's accents are heavy af. I got lost after she pronounced "ln" as "long". However each time she'll upload the materials (thank god her notes are okay) on canvas so I just skip her lectures.

Min Fan displayed wonderful hygiene in the first tutorial session where he cough all over the place. However, he is swift and responsible if you email him questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
A wise CUHK Econ major once said if the table that shows score vs sub-grades aren't publicly available at the start of the semester then it really isn't absolute grading, as they can just change the cutoffs. However the fact that 95%+: A+ is publicly known so I guess it's half absolute half relative grading.

Another wise HKUST CPEG major once said "You can't get A range in Math1014 you think you're [an Einstein who we knew]?"

HW: 15% * 90/100
MT: 35% * 92/100
Final: 50% * 100/100
Overall 95.7%

Grade: TO BE CONFIRMED
reviews.comment_workload:
Work hard if you wish to get good.

I don't think the ratings in workload mean anything. Min workload? Max workload? Optimal workload per grade point? Workload to learn?

The workload is justifiable. However I think you can get away with a B with little effort.

I cannot recall how many times i wrote "lim n->inf abs(a n+1 / a n)" but at least that is reflected in the exams

15% Webwork

Absolute grading

It was okay.
Boring as it may be, attending lectures and tutorials is useful for better understanding the contents.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is better in fall than in spring, or so I heard.
And they offered a system of max{30%midterm+55%final, 85%final} this time, which means you still have hope after messing up the midterm exam.
Plus, there is 8% bonus point in quiz.

Grading:
15% webwork
30% midterm
55% final
8% bonus quiz
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is relatively light.
You get 10 sets of webwork in total, and then 4 bonus quizzes.

reviews.author: Keju
reviews.comment_content:
Integrations
- Trigonometic integral
- Integration by parts
- Area
- Volume by revolution
- Arc length
- Surface area of revolution
- Volume by shells
- Approximation
- Improper integrals
- Partial fractions

Polar coordinates

Sequences&series
- infinite sequences and series
- integral&comparison test
- alternating series
- absolute convergence
- ratio and root tests
- power series
- Taylor and Maclaurin series

vectors
- dot product
- cross product
- perpendicular distance
- planes
- 3d vectors basically

I think around 35% of the course is already taught in International A Level. Especially the vectors. But if you did take A Level and got credit transfer for MATH1013, you better go learn limits by yourself because they're gonna assume you already know. You'll need it for this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Can't understand a thing. Sometimes he says something in cantonese i don't understand. His voice is also so monotonic it makes you fall asleep even after getting full 9 hours of sleep. Stopped going to class after.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean was really low, even though there are even year 4 students who take this class. The exams weren't hard I would say, but I don't know why I didn't do well either.

Mid term: 30%
Webwork (HW): 15%
Final: 55%
Quiz: +2%

--- OR ---

Webwork (HW): 15%
Final: 85%
Quiz: +2%
(if your final grade > midterm grade)

Quizzes are optional but they can bump up your grades by 2% which tbh doesn't seem like a lot.

Mean: 35%
My grade: 52%
Final grade: B
studied 2 days before final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only webwork HW and quizzes (online in Math support center).

Webwork HW is good to force yourself to actually learn ( -I wouldn't have studied for this for the whole semester if not for the HW and quizzes, and since I don't go to the lectures or tutorials, I would've flunked pretty bad).

reviews.author: Nayr
reviews.comment_content:
Integration and application of integration
Integration techniques
Power series
Vectors
reviews.comment_teaching:
Purpose of attending lecture is to know the teaching progress. Basically, if you are not confident with the content in this course, you can attend the tutorial session or do more exercise and practice more.
Avery's style of teaching is not suitable for me, there is no powerpoint during the lecture, just hand-copied notes from Avery. He will post it to the course page a few hours after the lecture. Therefore, it is optional whether you are going to copy the notes during lecture or not.
My tutor is Mr. Ho Ming Leung, his tutorial notes are nice and will give each theory an example question and full solution. There is additional exercise at the last page of the notes. However, I don't really know why the answer to additional exercise is not provided.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term exam: 30%
Final exam: 55%
Webwork:15%
Bonus quiz 8%
SD is large this semester, it is not absolute grading in this semester. However, you must get at least 40% of the course grade to get a pass in this course.
The mean for MT and Final is around 40% of the total mark because the performance of midterm is really poor so that Avery introduced another grading scheme which allowed students to omit their mid-term score. However, I think the final exam is more difficult than midterm so better work hard and try to score a higher mark in the midterm exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is only 11 HW this semester, which is around 1 webwork homework per 1.5-2 weeks.
4 Bonus quizes can save many people's grade.
Basically, you got plenty of time to do exercise on your own. My advice is to get familiar with the question first.

reviews.author: stone_cst
reviews.comment_content: This course is an extension of MATH 1013 but I think they are not related. MATH 1013 mostly focuses on differentiation but this course focuses on integration and series. Even you did not learn well in 1012/1013, you can still study properly and get a high grade because you seldom use the concept from MATH 1012/1013.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Okay. Not too bad, not good.
She was well-prepared but her English is so....
The lecture notes were her own notes. I think the notes were clear and concise. I only read her own notes and took the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% homework
35% midterm
50% final
8% bonus quiz
*Absolutely grading

The midterm exam is hard and so many classmates got a low mark(my session's mean is about 56/100). There was policy - bonus quiz for us to earn more overall mark.

The final exam questions are very similar to sample paper(similarity 90%). (my session's mean is about 7x/100)

My midterm mark is 69/100 and exam is 83/100. Also got full marks from homework and 7.x% bonus marks. Overall mark is about 88% and then the Final grade is A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite high. Needed lots of time to do homework every week.
Because you do not only finish and let it go. You need to learn and digest!!!

reviews.author: johnnyf
reviews.title: Not very difficult for this semester
reviews.comment_content:
Basic mathematics concepts required for science, engineering students. Most of them were taught in M2. It is an advantage if you take M1/M2 in your secondary school.

Most of the syllabus is about differentiation and integration. You also need to learn how to calculate the areas and the volumes. Vector is also taught in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures teach the concept and tutorials teach the skills in answering questions. Professor Lam Tsz Kin is a bit boring but you can easily understand his speaking if you understand Cantonese. He will cover all the syllabus but also include some out-of-syllabus knowledge in the lectures.

For the tutorials, LIANG Shixin is a good TA since she provided many teaching notes for students. She will teach the concept again in tutorials and answer your questions comprehensively. Even if you only go to the tutorials, you can still understand the concepts. She also provides some questions for students to teach the answering skills. Some of the questions are similar to the questions in examination.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course is graded in absolute grading. For this semester, the grading is about like this:

85-100: A
65/70-85: B
50-65/70: C
40-50: D
0-40: F

For the marks,
Webwork (15%)
Midterm exam (35%)
Final Exam (50%)
Bonus quizzes (8%)

It is difficult to fail the course if you complete all the webwork and the bonus quizzes, and they are not difficult to complete if you can find others to carry. The course is said to be very difficult for the past few years, but for this year, the final exam paper is very similar to the sample paper and many people get high marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance.
One midterm and one final.
4 bonus quizzes for you to improve a sub-grade, so please complete them.
Webwork is a bit annoying, but finishing them can ensure you understand the concepts well. These 15% can also hep you a lot.

Homework 12%

Midterm 33% + Final 55%

Final 88%
The second option was made due to everyone in the class sucked at the midterm test

Quiz is optional and provides extra score based on the questions that you are correct.

I believed I screwed up on both midterm and finals, but everyone screwed up and was above mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework every week and the workload is not heavy. As exams are taking a big part of this course, if you are confident at exams, you really donâ€™t need to do your homework.

reviews.author: K. H.
reviews.title: Practical Math Course
reviews.comment_content:
Although this course is designated as the subsequent course of MATH 1013, the focus of this course is more on computations and less on proofs. Even though there are some proof questions appear in the exam, you just need to memorise all the methods mechanically, unlike in MATH 1013 where some proofs requires your Math maturity. Moreover some skills in this course, such as definite integral and its application, Taylor's expansion, series and its convergence e.t.c., are actually very useful in further studies. So I recommend people who are from science and engineering school, regardless of their future major, should work harder in learning the materials.

One side note is that concept of vector is introduced at the end, which I believe people who studied M2 in high school should be rather familiar with. However for other students, such as those who studied M1 in high school, this would be a chance to learn vectors as a prerequisite of more advanced math courses, such as linear algebra.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Many has already commented Dr. Ho's teaching so I am not going to repeat. It is worth notice though that if you wish to choose Mathematics as your major (especially those who wish to choose pure maths track, though I would expect you be studying MATH 1024) , you might also want to sit other Professor's lecture or learn from additional reference book because his teaching many focus on computations and the transition from theory to application, which is not that helpful in developing math maturity and learning develop different concepts rigorously.

Einstein Kong is also a very helpful TA and he is also good at explaining abstract concepts. So do try to sit his tutorial (if there is).
reviews.comment_grading: In this semester, the Professors claimed that absolute grading scheme is used though I suspect grading curve is also employed. I am not in a very justified position to comment this so I shall refer to other comments for this section.
reviews.comment_workload: It really depends on your previous knowledge on calculus and your math maturity. M2 really helps reduce a lot of workload. However even if you haven't studied M2 before, you can theoretically avoid some workload as the assignments (WebWork) are rather trivial that you can find answers on the internet. Though this will probably cost your grade if you don't really understand how to solve the assignments. Bonus quizzes are useful in increasing sub grades or even avoiding failing this course so it is worth to try. You can refer to sample quiz and the actual quiz is about the same with number differences.

but try not to skip tutorials since they help to give an idea of what is taught in the lectures

And also make sure webwork are done and score full marks coz it contribute 15%

Quiz: full marks (additional 8%)

try to start it a week or two before so that you get enough time to understand and memorise those test and get time to do some practice so that you get familiar with the stuffs.

reviews.author: ç”¨ç”Ÿå‘½å€¼ç¡¬æ¥
reviews.comment_content:
Application of integration: area, volume, arc length, surface area, displacement, velocity, acceleration, work done
Integration techniques: by parts, substitution, trigonometric substitution, partial fraction, power series
Definite Integral
Fundamental theorem of calculus
Polar coordinates and its integral
Approximating definite integrals with trapezoidal, midpoint or Simpson's rule
Improper integral
Sequence
Series and tests for convergence/divergence of infinite series
Taylor Series and Maclaurin Series
Vectors

For me, series are the most challenging part
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Lam's teaching style is he writes on paper as he teaches, which is nice. He will also upload that paper as handwritten note afterward but for me, it is hard to read a math note written by the others.

Tutorial notes and exercises prepared by Phyllis are easy to read and they come with detailed solutions, which help learning the basics.

Zeta's exercises are on the tougher side in comparison, but it can definitely boost your ability for midterms and exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, provisional grade scale:
F < 40% < D < 50% < C-/+ < 65% < B-/+ < 85% < A-/+
15% Webwork
35% Midterm
50% Final
+8% Quiz (4 quizzes, 2% each)

My overall score is around 85.5%, just a bit higher than the A-range cut-off
Final grade A-

Sample midterm, final, and quizzes will be provided.
Calculator is not allowed for midterm and final. You can use a calculator at quiz but you cannot talk or go to web (eg: wolfram alpha).
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly webwork exercise, about 10-15 questions each
Took me about an hour for each exercise. If you can't finish the exercise, just go to Math center for help.

Better be prepared and complete all sample quizzes with FULL STEPS WRITTEN before attempting the real one. It will save you literally because some questions on sample quiz are very similar to the actual quiz.

Absolute Grading
Nothing to say, everything depended on your performance

reviews.author: twinkle
reviews.title: fair course
reviews.comment_content:
Just basic concepts in calculus, including:
volume
arc length
surface area for revolution
work
integration techniques
numerical integral
infinite sequence
infinite series
vectors
reviews.comment_teaching: Overall acceptable. TJ's teaching is generally well among the instructors of math department. He always has a clear thinking process and explains concepts clearly. However, I have to say that his lecture notes, which contain straightforward explanations of concepts and numerous examples,  are even better than his teaching. Actually, if you look through his lecture notes carefully, it is not essential for you to attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since there were bonus quizzes(8%) this semester, the grading was decent. But there are some differences in different semesters.
Grading scheme: 15% webwork + 35%midterm+ 50%final +8% bonus quizzes (4 quizzes in total)
Webwork: since there are unlimited attempts, I think you should try your best to get full marks since the questions are not that difficult.
Midterm: Difficult due to a tight time limit. You have to complete 11 MCs and 3 long questions in 1.5 hours, which is extremely challenging. However, if you are clear with the concepts and do enough exercise before the exam, it is high possible for you to get a satisfactory score.
Final: I think it is much easier than the midterm since the time limit is 3 hrs but only 4 MCs and 1 long question are added. If you are careful enough in the final exam, you are able to get a high score.
Bonus quizzes: difficulty and format similar to webwork. If you review the lecture notes carefully before taking each quiz, I think full marks are not difficult.
To conclude, if you do enough exercise after classes, A range is not difficult, but A+ needs some more efforts.
reviews.comment_workload: Overall moderate. 10 webworks in 13 weeks (but 1 in the midterm break, you have to remember the due date in case that you miss it). You just have to review the lecture notes before the exams, but if you grasp the concepts and formulas well, it won't take you too long.

reviews.author: I Want 1st Hon!
reviews.title: No A+...Though good grade for this semester!
reviews.comment_content:
Useful Course!

Week 1 Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, area between curves, volume by cross sections.
Week 2 Volume by cylindrical shells, work.
Week 3 Average value of a function, arc length, area of a surface of revolution.
Week 4 Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals.
Week 5 Trigonometric substitution, polar coordinates and calculus.
Week 6 Partial fractions, summary of integration techniques.
Midterm (Week 1-6)

Week 7 Approximation integration, improper integrals.
Week 8 Infinite sequences and series, integral test.
Week 9 Comparison tests, alternating series, absolute convergence, ratio and root tests.
Week 10 Power series, represention of functions as power series.
Week 11 Taylor and Maclaurin series, applications of Taylor polynomials, two and three dimensional coordinate systems, vector
Week 12 Dot product.
Week 13 Cross product.
Final (Week 1-13)

Retrieved from MATH1014 Website: http://www.math.ust.hk/~tklam/Math1014/index.html
reviews.comment_teaching:
The only instructor who is from Hong Kong...
He is nice to answer your questions after class. However, he does not reply email frequently...
He uses pens & papers to teach, no powerpoint or blackboard, but...WolframAlpha!
Well, The class size before midterm is totally FULL. only around 90 students are formally registered in SIS while >120 students come to take the lectures....>5 students have to stand or sit on the ground...if they are late for -5 minutes....You can see that there is a popularity of this lecturer.

I didn't attend any tutorial (taught by Phyllis Liang) except the first two tutorials...though I ask my friend to help me take the tutorial notes (coloured :)).
And I revise at home. She uploaded the tutorial solutions after few days of each tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 Webwork exercises... (15%)
Easy to finish, but difficult to finish in single try...though it is not required.
Definitely, I got total 15%
Our class mean: around 12.5%

4 Webwork quizzes: (BONUS 8%)
1.Volume (Week 1-2)
2.Work Done & Integration Techniques (Week 2, 4-6) (*No polar coordinate :))
3.Numerical Integration & Improper Integral (Week 7)
4. Infinite sequence & series (Week 8-9)
I got 10, 7, 10, 9.64 respectively.
So I only got 7.328%. Our class mean: 5.4%

MIDTERM: (35%)
Extremely difficult compared with MATH1013...maybe twice as hard...Though I carelessly did the work done problem (Q2)& integration by part problem (Q1); and don't understand the volume by slicing (Q3+Q4) and polar coordinate (Q4).

I got 71/100 only. Most of my friends got 80+...
Our class mean is around 53....More than 25% fail (<40%, i.e. <40 marks). Well, It showed that I did not revise well.

FINAL: (50%)
Ridiculously easy if you have done the sample paper once, or twice, or even multiple time...since it is mostly referred to the sample paper! This final exam definitely gave you a chance to up a grade (2-4 sub-grades) if you have performed badly in midterm.
Q1: Reduction Formula
Q2: Sequences & Improper integral
Q3: Series Test
Q4: Volume by Shell/Disc Method & Convergence Test
Q5: Interval of Convergence/Ratio/Root Test & Taylor/Maclaurin Series

Final: 95/100
Our class mean: 64.2
My final grade: A (94.68%), so sad...no A+...
Class mean: C+ (63.64%)

A range: ~97>A>~91>A->85
Range: 85>B>65>C>50>D>40>F
reviews.comment_workload:
Compare with other courses, It is really light...
Webwork is easy. Usually finish within an hour each. (10 webworks in total)
DO THE SAMPLE PAPERS!

reviews.author: Rebecca Law
reviews.title: Self-Study Course with good TA assitance
reviews.comment_content:
Volume of Revolution (simply using the formulas)
Polar coordinates (very brief)
Integration Technique
Sequences and Series
Alternating Series
Vectors (easy M2 level)

I certainly recommend students who may want to improve their poor mathematical mindset to try to read some more textbooks to ensure you can understand and get hold of the knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, I think his accent is difficult to comprehend if you do not read the textbook before class. During class, you mainly study the proof and orientation about the mathematical theory and formulas, which is seemingly useless regarding those quiz and exam questions for this course. I cannot deny the logic and mathematical induction is important, especially for long-term learning and in-depth study later, but such value is not significant during the exams. The TA is helpful and nice but sometimes emotional, but overall is outstanding. Make sure you seek help from the TA whenever you need help!
reviews.comment_grading: I am not sure about the professor. But generally I think I am delighted to get A- as I studied MATH1003 and my maths is so poor that I expected simply get C-range. I should express my gratitude to the TA as she has paid so much time and effort to save my crippled brain. One thing that is pretty obvious is that Fall sem is much more easier to get better results as many year 1 student from A-level will skip MATH1013 and study this course as well as professional engineering students will not take this course in Fall sem. For business student or students poor in mathematics, fall sem is the best time to take this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Simply finish the webwork and the questions behind the textbook and everything will be fine. Especially if you have studied M2 in secondary school and MATH1012/1013, this course will be great, maybe a little bit challenging, but fruitful.

reviews.author: Soulero.dlL
reviews.comment_content:
Keyword Syllabus:

Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Velocity and net change, area of a region between curves, volume by slicing and cylindrical shells.
Length of curves, surface area, and work.
Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions.
Numerical integration, improper integrals.
Sequences and infinite series, divergence and integral, ratio, root and comparison tests, alternating series.
Taylor polynomials, power series, and Taylor series.
Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross products.

Overall, calculus, vector, and series, integration
reviews.comment_teaching: HHM is ok who always explains in details and provides color lecture notes in each lecture.  He also puts lecture video on canvas. In case you skip lectures, it's still ok to catch up the things.
reviews.comment_grading:
Terrible,
Because of absolute grading,
you never expect get a good grade in this course
reviews.comment_workload: The only good thing is not much workload. Webwork is quite easy. It's about one webwork per week. If you want to get a satisfactory high mark in this course, you definitely need to devote more effect to tutorial w.s..

reviews.author: Anisha
reviews.comment_content:
The amount of content is very reasonable for the length of the semester provided that you provide consistent effort throughout. Once you slack, it gets super difficult to catch up and the exam week becomes a nightmare. You need to put a decent amount of effort in solving past papers and tutorial notes because the sums in the exams are similar but a lot more challenging. If conceptual understanding is not attained, forget even about a B.

NOTE: IF ANYONE NEEDS CLEAR SOLUTIONS TO MOST OF THE TUTORIAL NOTES SUMS, FEEL FREE TO HIT ME UP!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Avery's lectures were basically lessons on how a simple formula or relationship was derived which is completely useless when it comes to doing well in exams. He will direct questions to the students and end up answering them himself almost immediately lol. He has a very thick accent which gets a few weeks at least to get accustomed to and by the time you do, you realize half of the semester has gone by and you have better things to do than decipher the lecturer's accent and that's when you start running to the MSC, desperate for help that you don't even seem to know where.

On the other hand, Phyllis is an excellent TA. The way she will explain concepts to you are exemplary. She will ingrain them in your mind and make sure you understand fully before moving on. However, she has a slight accent problem but it is way easier to comprehend than Avery's.

All in all, I'd recommend skipping the lectures but following the tutorials religiously.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass and fail is absolute but the final grade is curved depending on the mean and SD. In Fall 2017, the mean for the midterm was about one-third of the full mark and for finals, it was less than 50%. That is how badly people score. And since midterm and final weighs about 33% and 55% respectively, you're screwed.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload depends on you, honestly. You decide whether you practice the tutorial sums and do the assignments on your own to do well in the exams or you can wait till the last moment to screw yourself over.  But in general, its just webwork and bonus quizzes which you can too give or not.

reviews.author: AlexBBBB
reviews.comment_content: Only covered part of the DSE syllabus, that means you have to learn a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching: She will just fill in the blank of her notes, with mainland accent. However, her hand writing is beautiful.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading which mean it is quite suck for the grade. if you just have a bear pass, the grade most likely will be C-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Webwork 15%
mid term 35%
final 50%
with extra bonus quiz 8%
remember to do the quiz, this can most likely help you up a 2 sub grade if you get correctly.
Also you can use web math calculator, just dun let the ta to see that.

reviews.author: keith Wong
reviews.title: MATH1014
reviews.comment_content:
If BDSM is your thing, then you'll enjoy this. You get to learn all sorts of ways to torture yourself you didn't even know existed!!! From the light and kinky stuff like volumes of revolution to the hardcore and masochistic stuff like series expansions and partial fractions expansions.

Okay, in all seriousness, it's Calculus 2 for those who follow the US curriculum. You learn integration techniques for the first half then you go on to learning series, sequences etc in the second half. I'm sure it's useful stuff, but still hard none the less.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Extremely difficult to understand what he's saying. He has about a 1:1 ratio of filler words to actual words when "teaching". So when he teaches it goes something like this "uhh, so uhhh, today we will ummm, be talking about uhhh integration by errrr parts. To uhhhh integrate........" When I heard that on the first class, I knew that I was in for a very bad time.

Basically non-existent teaching. Instructor blitz through the content like there's no tomorrow. If you go to class, you can only hope to learn something through osmosis, because you'll be furiously taking notes that you'll never read/won't understand or you'll give up half way and just start playing with your phone or flirting with the girl next to you. Which you can then flex your intelligence and show her how much you've self learned.

To rub salt into the wound, you get NDS students who seem to understand everything to the point where they can even correct the instructor's careless mistakes. fml. If they're that good, why even go to class??
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute bullshit. You get essentially a bi-modal distribution where you have us double digit IQ locals getting 30/100 and you have the 10% of students who say that this course was a breeze and get 90+/100 for everything. Mid term and final was a bloodbath
reviews.comment_workload: The only redeeming thing about this course is the workload. The only continuous assessment that is given is the infamous webwork. However, the webwork gives you unlimited tries so you can slowly guess your way through each assesment which takes only about 1.5-2 hours each on average. Or you could Wolfram Alpha that shit and be done in 15 minutes if you don't give a damn about learning the material.

reviews.author: MatthewWong
reviews.comment_content:
Moderate difficulty.
This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the second in the MATH 1013 â€“ MATH 1014 sequence. Topics include applications of definite integral, improper integrals, vectors, curves and parametric equations, modeling with differential equations, solving simple differential equations, infinite sequences and series, power series and Taylor series.
reviews.comment_teaching: I dont know because I didn't attend the lectures. But the lecture notes and tutorial notes are very detailed, so you can just read the notes and do the exercise and need not to attend classes. Good for those who have a tight schedule.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good grade.
final percent ~90%: A+

It is originally a absolute grading course, but since the original mean % is a Fail, the professor adjusted the grading and lowered the curve.
reviews.comment_workload:
Low.
Webwork 12%
Midterm 33%
Final 55%
4 bonus quiz 2% each
